security.mixed_content.description: Mixed content occurs when HTTPS pages load HTTP resources, creating security vulnerabilities. Secure sites should load all resources over HTTPS to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks.

security.https_status.description: HTTPS ensures encrypted communication between browser and server. Secure context indicates the site is served over HTTPS and has access to modern security APIs.

security.form_security.description: Forms should submit data over HTTPS to protect sensitive information from interception. Insecure form submissions expose user data to man-in-the-middle attacks.

security.meta_policies.description: Security meta tags (CSP, X-Frame-Options, Referrer-Policy) provide client-side security controls. Multiple policies indicate defense-in-depth security implementation.

security.hsts.description: HSTS forces browsers to only connect via HTTPS, preventing protocol downgrade attacks. Required for A+ security rating. Should include max-age, includeSubDomains, and preload directives.

top_categories.name: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation

security.csp_header.description: CSP is the most important security header, controlling which resources browsers can load. Prevents XSS, injection attacks, and unauthorized resource loading. Header version is preferred over meta tag.

security.xcto.description: Prevents MIME type sniffing attacks by forcing browsers to respect declared content types. Should always be set to 'nosniff'. Easy to implement with significant security benefit.

top_categories.name: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type

security.referrer_header.description: Controls how much referrer information is shared with other sites. Recommended value is 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin' to balance privacy and functionality.

security.permissions_policy.description: Controls which browser features can be used (camera, microphone, geolocation, etc.). Replaces deprecated Feature-Policy. Required for A+ rating on modern security scanners.

security.coop.description: Isolates browsing context from cross-origin windows. Recommended value is 'same-origin'. Part of modern cross-origin isolation security architecture.

top_categories.name: Permissive Cross-domain Policy with Untrusted Domains

security.coep.description: Prevents loading cross-origin resources without explicit permission. Recommended value is 'require-corp'. Enables powerful browser features like SharedArrayBuffer.

security.corp.description: Protects resources from being loaded by other origins. Recommended value is 'same-site'. Prevents resource theft and side-channel attacks.
